meanings.definition: An individual or collaborative enterprise that is carefully planned to achieve a particular aim.
meanings.sent1: Our school science project involved growing plants to learn about photosynthesis.
meanings.sent2: The construction project to build a new library started last month.
meanings.sent3: The baking project turned into a floury mess when the recipe went wrong.
meanings.sent4: Her dream of becoming a successful artist was a project she worked on tirelessly.
meanings.sent5: The charity project aimed to provide clean water to remote villages in need.

meanings.sent1: The renovation project for the old house will begin next week.
meanings.sent2: The government announced a new infrastructure project to improve transportation.
meanings.sent3: The birthday surprise project for Mom was almost ruined when she almost found out.
meanings.sent4: His ambitious project to climb Mount Everest was met with both excitement and fear.
meanings.sent5: The community project aimed to create a safe space for children to play and learn.

meanings.definition: To estimate or forecast (something) on the basis of present trends or data.
meanings.sent1: The economist tried to project the country's economic growth for the next year.
meanings.sent2: She projected that the sales would increase by 10% after the marketing campaign.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecaster projected a sunny day, but it ended up raining heavily.
meanings.sent4: His confident demeanor projected a sense of leadership and authority.
meanings.sent5: The professor projected the final exam date to be in two weeks.
